result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Walter Schneider

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Walter Schneider not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for David Walter Schneider.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting additional scheduling to review discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Walter Schneider appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for David Walter Schneider.  Prosecuting Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior OWI convictions. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer C. Iaquinta. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant David Walter Schneider not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Schneider is not present by video from Dodge for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, appear by video. Defendant David Walter Schneider not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Dodge fail to produce denfendant for court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant David Walter Schneider not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. States witness is present. The defendant is housed at Dodge and was not scheduled to appear for today with that institution. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant David Walter Schneider not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Steven Andrew Sargent in trial this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant David Walter Schneider in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant David Walter Schneider in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David Walter Schneider appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 1620 Rivers BND # 112, Wauwatosa, WI 53226
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
